evaluations.name: dropped frames check
evaluations.description: pass when there are no dropped frames

evaluations.name: Basic Configuration
evaluations.description: pass when researcher name is not default name, and code repo is clean

metrics.name: researcher name
metrics.description: Experimenter name should not be set to the default value of "the ghost in the shell"

metrics.name: untracked local changes
metrics.description: Whether the code base had untracked changes, and if so, which files

evaluations.name: Side bias
evaluations.description: pass when average side bias is less than 0.5

metrics.name: average side bias
metrics.description: average side bias should be less than 0.5

evaluations.name: Lick Intervals
evaluations.description: pass when lick intervals <100ms are less than 10 percent of licks

metrics.name: Left Lick Interval (%)
metrics.description: % of lick intervals < 50ms. These indicate grooming bouts

metrics.name: Right Lick Interval (%)
metrics.description: % of lick intervals < 50ms. These indicate grooming bouts

metrics.name: Cross Side Lick Interval (%)
metrics.description: % of lick intervals < 50ms. These indicate grooming bouts

metrics.name: Artifact Percent (%)
metrics.description: % of lick intervals less than 0.5ms. These indicate electical artifacts

evaluations.name: Session Length Check
evaluations.description: pass when at least 50 trials were performed, and stimulus epoch was at least 10 minutes

metrics.name: Number of completed trials
metrics.description: Must complete at least 50 trials to pass

lens.name: Behavior Video Lens Bottom of face

daqs.name: harp behavior board
daqs.notes: Left lick spout and Right lick spout, as well as reward delivery solenoids are connected via ethernet cables

calibrations.description: Spot check of water calibration for Lick spout Left. The input is the valve open time in seconds and the output is the volume of water delievered in microliters. The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

Spot check of water calibration for Lick spout Left. The input is the valve open time in seconds and the output is the volume of water delievered in microliters. The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.
Water calibration for Lick spout Left. The input is the valve open time in seconds and the output is the volume of water delivered in microliters.

Spot check of water calibration for Lick spout Right. The input is the valve open time in seconds and the output is the volume of water delievered in microliters. The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

The valve open time was selected to produce 2ul of water. This measurement was used to check the previous calibration, and was not used to set the calibration.

software.name: dynamic-foraging-task
software.version: behavior branch:main   commit ID:94823a7969e2f423cdb2eab12d55023efe4c5156    version:1.6.33; metadata branch: main   commit ID:94823a7969e2f423cdb2eab12d55023efe4c5156   version:1.6.33

stimulus_epochs.notes: The duration of go cue is 100 ms. The frequency is 7500 Hz. Amplitude is 72dB. The total reward consumed in the session is 260.0 microliters. The total reward including consumed in the session and supplementary water is 1.0 milliliters.
